H0.text: Which bird was once called apteryx. Ostrich

H1.text: Which bird was once called apteryx. Penguin

H2.text: Which bird was once called apteryx. Emu

H3.text: Which bird was once called apteryx. Kiwi

A4.text: The genus name Apteryx is derived from Ancient Greek 'without wing': a- (ἀ-), 'without' or 'not'; ptéryx (πτέρυξ), 'wing'.

A5.text: George Shaw named the genus Apteryx in his species description of the southern brown kiwi.
